title: Configure VS Code workspace settings
description: Create .vscode/ directory with settings.json (Python path, formatters, linters), extensions.json (recommended extensions), and launch.json (debug configurations) for optimal development experience.

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Configured VS Code workspace settings:

**settings.json:**
- Python interpreter: .venv/bin/python
- Testing: pytest with coverage enabled
- Linting: mypy with strict mode (disabled pylint/flake8)
- Formatting: Ruff as default formatter with format-on-save
- Editor: 88 char ruler, organize imports on save
- File exclusions: __pycache__, .pytest_cache, .mypy_cache, .ruff_cache
- IntelliSense: strict type checking, auto-imports
- PYTHONPATH: src/ directory

**extensions.json:**
- Recommended: Python, Pylance, Ruff, mypy, Markdown, YAML, TOML, GitLens, EditorConfig
- Unwanted: pylint, flake8 (using Ruff instead)

**launch.json:**
- Debug configurations:
  - Current file
  - Consoul CLI module
  - Current test file
  - All tests (with/without coverage)
  - Debug specific test function
  - MkDocs serve

**tasks.json:**
- Install dependencies
- Run tests (default test task)
- Lint, format, type-check
- Quality check (all)
- Build package (default build task)
- Build/serve documentation
- Clean artifacts
- Pre-commit hooks
- Update dependencies

All tasks use Makefile targets for consistency.
